newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee ends steady vs dlr, forwards volatile.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee ends steady vs dlr, forwards volatile.

text.p: The Indian rupee ended Wednesday at 35.65/66 per dollar, virtually unchanged from the day's opening quotes of 35.65/67, dealers said.
The rupee moved in a two-paise band on Wednesday, trading at a high of 35.65 and a low of 35.67 per dollar, they said.
Dealers said there was good dollar supply while the expected deamnd from a leading state-run bank did not materialise.
The Reserve Bank of India bought end-August dollars outright for 35.72/73 rupees, dealers said.

Brisk activity was reported in forwards where the six-month premia crossed the 12 percent level in early trade on paying pressure. Dealers said fears of tightening domestic money market conditions could also have played a part in pushing up premia.
Forward premia came down later during the day on profit-taking and on receiving pressure from financial institutions, dealers said.
The premia for six-month dollars ended Wednesday around 11.45 percent against the opening levels of 11.39 percent.
